name: Frank Sinatra Movies Trivia Game | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Sinatra made a fair number of World War II movies. Which of these was one of them?
questions.explanation:
Von Ryan's Express.

	This was about an escape from a P.O.W. camp.

questions.text: Sinatra starred in 'The Manchurian Candidate' with Laurence Harvey. Who played Harvey's controlling, evil mother?
questions.explanation:
Angela Lansbury.

	She was playing a much older woman.

questions.text: 'The Tender Trap' was a nice, light comedy. Who was the girl that Sinatra ended up marrying?
questions.explanation:
Debbie Reynolds.

	All of the others were in the movie as well.

questions.text: Is there a more unlikely event than finding 'The Three Stooges' in a Frank Sinatra movie?  Which movie was it?
options: It's A Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad, World
questions.explanation:
Four for Texas.

	He starred in this movie with Dino.

questions.text: Who plays Sinatra's girlfriend in 'Young at Heart'?
questions.explanation:
Doris Day.

	'Young at Heart' was a nice song.

questions.text: Sinatra's most famous movie role may have been as Maggio in 'From Here to Eternity'. Who plays the evil sergeant that torments Maggio?
questions.explanation:
Ernest Borgnine.

	In my opinion, this was a really good movie.

questions.text: 'The Detective' was a popular novel before it became a Sinatra movie. Who was the author?
questions.explanation:
Roderick Thorpe.

	The movie was just 'okay'.

questions.text: One of Sinatra's popular songs is 'All the Way'. From which movie did it come?
questions.explanation:
The Joker Is Wild.

	The other options are also Sinatra movies.

questions.text: Speaking of music, Sinatra was in 'High Society'. This was a musical re-make of what movie?
options: You Can't Take It With You
questions.explanation:
The Philadelphia Story.

	Bing Crosby and Grace Kelly starred in this musical, too.

questions.text: Again with musicals, Sinatra starred in 'Guys and Dolls'. What role did he play?
questions.explanation:
Nathan Detroit.

	He acted with Brando in this musical.
